types.name: firecrackers
types.description: Fireworks intended to explode and make loud noises

types.name: smoke bombs
types.description: Most smoke bombs donâ€™t explode, they just, well, smoke

types.name: rockets
types.description: Fireworks that whistle while blasting off into the sky and explode when they reach their peak

types.name: linear shaped charge
types.description: The detonation projects into the lining, to form a continuous, knife-like jet. The jet cuts any material in its path, to a depth depending on the size and materials used in the charge

types.name: explosively formed penetrator
types.description: An EFP uses the action of the explosive's detonation wave to project and deform a plate or dish of ductile metal into a compact high-velocity projectile, commonly called the slug. This slug is projected toward the target at about two kilometers per second.

types.name: tandem warhead
types.description: A charge, consisting of two separate shaped charges, one in front of the other, typically with some distance between them.
